translations: (to) put the top (/ lid etc) on
(to) go on the streets / the game
put / pile / stack … one on top of the other!
(you-formal) put / pile / stack … one on top of the other
(he/she/it) puts / pile / stack … one on top of the other
have a snack in the afternoon!
(you-formal) have a snack in the afternoon
(he/she/it) has a snack in the afternoon
(to) have a stockholding / an interest in
fixed oneself up with a good job

Ask tactful questions.text: de la noche a la mañana

Communicate precisely.text: con las manos en la masa
